utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: What brings you in today?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I I've been having uh, this fever, the last couple of days and I've had a cough as well and my nose is, keeps running.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And when did the fevers start?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I think the fever started two days ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: How, did you measure your magic temperature?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, it was 38 point .5 when I when I checked it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And have you been checking it out past days? Has it gotten better or worse?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's been about the same both both days.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And your cough, when did that start?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Cough started four days ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, is it a wet cough or dry cough?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's been dry.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I've been bringing up any blood or any mucus or anything like that.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, and I haven't had a cough before either. This is new.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and the runny nose, what kind of discharge, or what like what's coming out of your nose?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's pretty pretty watery and clear.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, alright, and when did that start?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, yeah, sorry that started about four days ago as well, so about the same time as the cough.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you had any other symptoms, such as having a stuffy nose that have congestion in your sinuses, sore throat? Umm, red eyes? Watery, teary eyes? Sneezing, any of those symptoms.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, no nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any difficulties breathing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any pain in your chest?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any headaches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh yeah I have had a bit of a headache, actually. Well, just just this morning.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: How how bad is it?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's pretty mild. Something pretty simple like it, so I've had headaches like like this before. It's not, it's not a big deal.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And do you have any fatigue or muscle aches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No muscle aches, but yeah, I have been fatigued last a couple of days. Two or three days.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any changes in your sense of smell?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Changes in your sense of taste?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any pain in your belly or any diarrhea?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK? Alright um, any medical conditions that you've been diagnosed with?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh. No, I I've been, I've been healthy.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any surgeries or hospitalizations?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't had anything like that before.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And do you take any medications?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I'm not.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and allergies to food or medications, or environmental allergies?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I think I have an allergy to penicillin. I got it, I had a rash when I was I younger when I had that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and do you currently? Would you currently let that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, so I I just live with my with my mom.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, do you have any pets at home?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, it's just us two, uh, we live in a in a townhouse in in the city.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Nice, OK. And do you do you or your mom go out for school or for work?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh yeah, I've been going been going to school. I know with the some of the lockdowns and what not the schools been open so we've been going. They've been pretty cautious with the covid protocols. And but my mom's been working from home.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, good. Do you feel like you or your mom may have had contact with anyone who could have potentially been sick?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, I mean, maybe at the school or something like that, but I can't think of anybody who who's been sick.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, alright, have you traveled anywhere outside the province?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, uhm. And, uh, do you I guess a couple of other more general questions. Do you feel safe at home?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I do, yeah. We have a good a good relationship.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I'm glad, I'm glad, and an anything that we discuss will see confidential between you and me, unless there's something that you could be talk about that could harm you or harm anyone else. Do you feel safe at school?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yes, I do. I enjoy school. It's been fun.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: That's good, that's good. And have you can have been consuming the drug? Tried anything?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I've heard of other people. I mean in high school doing stuff like that, but I haven't been around anything like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, alright. Any alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, are you sexually active?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright. And uh, let's see so.. uh, you've had a fever, a cough, and a runny nose for the past few days. And have you been going to school? In the past couple of days or no?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I know I've taken the last couple of days off, just been so tired and not feeling good so, yeah well.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK. So yeah, it sounds like you might have some sort of viral infection which could potentially be covid, but could also be another sort of another viral illness, just like the common cold or the flu. Um, so I'll request that we get a covid swab done and the results should come back in 24 to 48 hours and um, just try to self isolate as much as possible. Don't go to school, don't meet other people. Try to stay away from your mom as well. And based on the results, you'll get more guidance from public health nurses, and you should just continue to sort of rest and drink lots of water. Maybe take Tylenol or Advil if that's making you feel better and hopefully your symptoms will get better. If not, if you feel like your symptoms are persisting for days or week or so, or you're having worsening symptoms, definitely come back or give us a call.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
